title.narrative: F.a: Public Sector Trade Union Law and Quality Public Services

description.narrative: The project campaigns for legislation change to ensure public sector negotiation rights in all ten provinces of Mozambique. Related to this are mobilisation trainings especially for young and female workers. The union leadership develops a new strategy and based on that a new union-building project will be planned towards the end of the year 2014, with two alternative scenarios in mind: a) if the current public sector bill is passed into law, starting 2015 a massive organising campaign and basic rights trai ning will be initiated; and b) if the law does not pass, campaigning will continue until it does, and at the same time more members are organised and trained in basic rights.Public sector workers form the largest group of employees in Mozambique having for mal employment contracts; hence the Mozambican public sector trade union SINAFP could be the biggest and most influential union of the country. However, it does not have officially recognised position as the legitimate representative of workers and a negot iation partner. Therefore the reasons for workers to join the union are little, which in turn weakens the weight of the union in bringing about changes. This is why the change of legislation is the key for respect of workers’ rights, and also a prerequis ite for the existence and functioning of the union. The Parliament of Mozambique developed a proposal for the law already in the beginning of 2010’s, and in this process comments from SINAFP and the global union federation of public services PSI were par tly taken into account. Since 2012 the government authorities have made repeated promises to get the law passed, but still the process is on-going. Visible and public campaigning especially in the election year 2014 can promote passing of the law, which wo uld be a very significant step towards full trade union rights.The project supports the campaign regarding public sector freedom of association and negotiation rights. A new union development project for the years 2015-2017 will be planned before the end o f this pilot.Beneficiaries of the project are union members, leaders and public sector workers.The project is implemented by the global federation of public sector unions Public Services International (PSI) and its Mozambican affiliate Sindicato Nacional d e Funcao Publica (SINAFP).
